body_html:
Is it possible that there is a conflicting (older) version of the C library that is being linked against?
You can figure that out with something like this:

go test -c
ldd go.test

And ensuring that the path to libtensorflow_framework.so is the correct one.

Alternatively, try something like this:

cat <<EOF >/tmp/foo.go
package main

import (
  "fmt"
  tf "github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go"
)

func main() {
  fmt.Println(tf.Version())
}
EOF

go run /tmp/foo.go

You should see the same version as the branch you've checked out.
If not, then it would appear that you're linking against the incorrect version of the C library.

Hope that helps.

body:
Is it possible that there is a conflicting (older) version of the C library that is being linked against? 
You can figure that out with something like this:

```sh
go test -c
ldd go.test
```

And ensuring that the path to `libtensorflow_framework.so` is the correct one.

Alternatively, try something like this:

```
cat <<EOF >/tmp/foo.go
package main

import (
  "fmt"
  tf "github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go"
)

func main() {
  fmt.Println(tf.Version())
}
EOF

go run /tmp/foo.go
```

You should see the same version as the branch you've checked out.
If not, then it would appear that you're linking against the incorrect version of the C library.

Hope that helps.
